0.title: There's groundswell of anger against BJP across J&K: Farooq Abdullah
0.article_body: National Conference (NC) President Farooq Abdullah on Monday said that there is a groundswell of anger against BJP across J&K and the people there have made it a point to stand up for their rights. Furthermore, he said that the NC will make every effort to give voice to the aspirations and demands of the people of J&K.

1.title: Traffic block at Pune's Chandani Chowk from 12.30 am to 1 am from today
1.article_body: The traffic on Pune's Chandani Chowk stretch will be stopped for 30 minutes between 12.30 am and 1 am for 8-10 days starting today. The Pune district administration and the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) have taken the decision to carry out rock blasting work for the ongoing construction of the new bridge and service road.

2.title: Mulayam Singh's mortal remains kept at Saifai's Numaish ground; people pay last respects
2.article_body: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's mortal remains have been kept at Numaish ground in Saifai, his ancestral home, for people to pay their last respects. The three-time UP CM's last rites will be performed on Tuesday. The cremation is scheduled to take place around 3 pm. Mulayam Singh passed away aged 82 in Haryana on Monday.

3.title: Mumbai Crime Branch arrests 5 linked to Dawood Ibrahim's D gang
3.article_body: The Anti Extortion Cell of the Mumbai Crime Branch has arrested five people who are associated with the D gang of underworld don Dawood Ibrahim in connection with an extortion case. This comes after the arrest of gangster Salim Fruit, a close aide of gangster Chhota Shakeel and Riyaz Bhati, who in turn are close aides of Dawood.

4.title: Woman on scooter gets run over after being hit by door of car; K'taka govt shares video
4.article_body: Karnataka State Road Safety Authority has shared a video of a woman two-wheeler rider falling and getting run over by a vehicle after being hit by a parked car's door. "Before opening the door of your car on public roads, make sure to check in the side or rear view mirror for vehicles coming from behind," the authority tweeted.

5.title: Political fallout hasn't influenced my relationship with B'wood: Fawad Khan
5.article_body: Pakistani actor Fawad Khan said the "political fallout (between India and Pakistan)" hasn't influenced his relationship with the Hindi film industry. Talking about his Bollywood comeback, Fawad said people who'd like to collaborate with him will "suffer the consequences". He added, "Similarly, if I were to work [in India] and come back (to Pakistan), I'd have to suffer the consequences."

6.title: Told Babar 'Ask Shaheen to bowl yorker at 100 mph' to dismiss Rohit: Raja
6.article_body: Sharing his conversation with Babar Azam regarding the T20 World Cup 2021 match between India and Pakistan, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said, "[I told Babar] I can tell you how to...dismiss Rohit Sharma." "Babar was intrigued. I said, 'Get Shaheen Afridi [to]...bowl...[an] inswinging yorker at 100 mph and don't give Rohit a single...You will get him out'," stated Raja.

7.title: Make this Diwali a happy and healthy Diwali: Oleev
7.article_body: Oleev shared that since cooking oil used in food matters as much as the ingredients, one must make a conscious choice in choosing it, especially during the festive season. Oleev Active is a multisource oil with the goodness of olive oil for Indian cooking, it stated, encouraging customers to choose health, good habits and a proactive lifestyle this Diwali.

8.title: Aaron Finch reprimanded by ICC after stump mic catches him abusing umpire
8.article_body: Australia captain Aaron Finch has been handed an official reprimand for breaching Level 1 of ICC Code of Conduct during the first T20I against England in Perth on Sunday. Finch was caught by the stump mic abusing umpire during a confusion over DRS in the ninth over of England's innings. One demerit point has been added to Finch's disciplinary record.

9.title: My father thought I won't pass, I got around 66% in Class 10 boards: MS Dhoni
9.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni, at a recent event, said that his father thought he would not pass his Class 10 board exam. Dhoni added, "He [thought] it's gone and that I will have to repeat." Dhoni added that he went on to get around 66% marks. "He was very happy that I passed," Dhoni further said.

10.title: Twitter ordered Zatko to burn notebooks, delete files to destroy evidence: Musk
10.article_body: Elon Musk has accused Twitter officials of ordering whistleblower Peiter Zatko to destroy evidence of their missteps as part of a $7.8 million severance package. Musk's lawyers claimed in a court filing that Zatko burned 10 handwritten notebooks and deleted 100 computer files at the behest of Twitter managers. The documents contained notes of Zatko's meetings with the company's officials.

11.title: Shinde faction submits new symbols 'shining sun', 'shield & sword' to EC
11.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena on Tuesday submitted new party symbols 'shining sun', 'shield & sword' and 'peepul tree' as its election symbol options to Election Commission of India (ECI). The new symbols were submitted days after EC's order of freezing Shiv Sena's name and election symbol. Shiv Sena's Uddhav Thackeray faction was allotted 'flaming torch' as their election symbol.

12.title: Crypto firm Coinbase gets Singapore licence for payment services
12.article_body: Coinbase, the US' largest cryptocurrency exchange, received approval from Singapore's central bank to offer payment services in the city. Coinbase called it a "significant milestone" and said it has been building up its presence in Singapore and currently had nearly 100 employees there. About 180 crypto firms applied for payment licences in Singapore and 17 have received in-principle approvals.

13.title: Axar Patel can do it: Chahal on Ravindra Jadeja's alternative for T20 WC
13.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has backed Axar Patel to do the job for the team in all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's absence in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "No one can take Jadeja's place. But the way Axar has been bowling, we've found one alternative...he can do it," stated Chahal. Axar has picked a total of 10 wickets in last six T20Is.

14.title: No data compromise proof found from cyberattack: Lloyd's of London
14.article_body: Insurance company Lloyd's of London, which was investigating a possible cyberattack, said on Monday that it had found no evidence of data compromise. "Lloyd's has been advised that its network services can now be restored," the company said. The firm had detected "an unusual activity on its network" as companies are on high alert for intrusions due to Russia-Ukraine conflict.

15.title: Iran adds centrifuges banned under 2015 nuke deal to underground plant: Report
15.article_body: Iran has brought advanced centrifuges at its underground plant at Natanz, Reuters said citing a confidential report by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The 2015 nuclear deal banned Iran from adding these advanced centrifuges to enrich uranium. The indirect talks between Iran and the United States on reviving the 2015 nuclear deal have been stalled.

16.title: Musk's Starlink in talks with DoT for satellite communication services in India: Report
16.article_body: Elon Musk's Starlink is reportedly in talks with the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) for a  licence to deliver satellite-based communication services in India. To provide this service, companies need to get Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite (GMPCS) licence from the government. The report while quoting sources said that Starlink is likely to apply for the same within a month.

17.title: Big B surprises fans waiting outside his home at midnight for his birthday
17.article_body: A video showing Amitabh Bachchan surprising fans waiting outside his home at midnight for his 80th birthday has surfaced online. The video also shows fans hugging each other in joy, upon Bachchan's arrival. The actor stepped out of his bungalow along with his daughter Shweta Bachchan Nanda and granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda.

18.title: Chief Justices of Rajasthan, Karnataka, J&K and Ladakh HCs named
18.article_body: The central government has notified the transfer of Justice Pankaj Mithal to Rajasthan High Court as the Chief Justice. Justice PB Varale has been appointed as the Chief Justice of Karnataka High Court, while Justice AM Magrey as the Chief Justice of J&K and Ladakh High Court, tweeted Union Minister Kiren Rijiju.

19.title: Big B's Israeli fan says he's learnt Hindi only by listening to his dialogues
19.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan's fan from Israel, Moses Sapir, said he has learnt to speak Hindi only by listening to the actor's dialogues. "I have seen most of [his] films more than 200 times...films like 'Silsila' and 'Main Azaad Hoon' were a bit tough for me to understand during my childhood...watching these films repeatedly made me become extremely fond," he added.

20.title: Congress came to power in Raj due to strength of party workers: Pilot
20.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday said that the Congress came to power in Rajasthan in 2018 because of the strength of its workers who had struggled for five years. Furthermore, he said that party workers and leaders are working collectively to ensure the party's victory in the 2023 Assembly polls.

21.title: TSRTC's new facility to allow people to track 3,800 buses in real-time
21.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC)  has created a new facility that will allow passengers to track buses in real-time. This facility will allow passengers to track 3,800 buses in real-time. Reports said that the authorities have installed a tracking device in buses for this purpose. Passengers will be able to see arrival and departure times too.

22.title: Yati Narsinghanand gets bail in case linked to Muzaffarnagar riots
22.article_body: Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi temple priest Yati Narsinghanand was released on bail after he surrendered before a court in Uttar Pradesh in a case linked to 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots. According to Prosecution Officer Niraj Singh, Narsinghanand is among the 21 accused, including Union Minister Sanjeev Balyan, facing charges of violating prohibitory orders and inciting communal violence.

23.title: No legal basis to act on Russian superyacht: Hong Kong leader
23.article_body: Hong Kong leader John Lee said the city has "no legal basis" to act on a luxury yacht belonging to sanctioned Russian oligarch Alexey Mordashov. "We'll [only] comply with UN sanctions," Lee added. Mordashov was sanctioned by the European Union and US, but not the UN after Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The yacht docked in Hong Kong waters last week.

24.title: CJI UU Lalit recommends Justice DY Chandrachud as his successor
24.article_body: Chief Justice of India UU Lalit has recommended the name of Justice DY Chandrachud as his successor. Justice UU Lalit, who took oath as the Chief Justice on August 27, is set to retire on November 8 this year. The appointment of Justice DY Chandrachud will make him the 50th Chief Justice of India.

25.title: Flew Smith to Perth to make him 12th man, that's not right: Michael Clarke
25.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke has criticised the Australian management for not including Steve Smith in their playing XI for the first England T20I. "Flew Smith to Perth to make him 12th man, that's not right," stated Clarke. On Australia's batting order for the T20 WC, Clarke added, "If Smith [is batting at four], you've got to give him some cricket."

26.title: NCP, Shiv Sena, SP to take part in Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra
26.article_body: As the Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra is set to reach Maharashtra on November 9, NCP, Shiv Sena, SP and other like-minded parties will be taking part in the campaign. "The BJP government at the Centre has made the future of citizens dark. The BJP wants to eliminate other parties through non-parliamentary means," said Congress leader Nana Patole.

27.title: NIA conducts raids at multiple locations in J&K in terror funding case
27.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday carried out raids at multiple locations in Jammu and Kashmir in a terror funding case. The searches were conducted at locations in the districts of Rajouri, Poonch, Jammu, Srinagar, Pulwama, Budgam, Shopian and Bandipora. The case is related to the suspicious activities of Al Huda Educational Trust in J&K's Rajouri, as per reports.

28.title: TCS to give 100% variable pay to 70% of employees for Q2 FY23
28.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will give 100% variable pay to 70% of its employees for the second quarter of FY23. "The remaining 30% of employees will be paid...based on the business unit performance," Chief Human Resources Officer Milind Lakkad said. In August, TCS said it hadn't delayed variable payout for Q1 and it was fully paid out to all employees.

29.title: Thai PM orders tighter gun rules after mass shooting killed 36 people
29.article_body: After an ex-policeman killed 36 people including 24 children in Thailand, Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha ordered authorities to revoke the gun licences of registered owners who have reportedly behaved in a way that "threatens society". He has also ordered search and test for the use of illicit drugs among officials. Regular mental checks will be reportedly required for gun licence.

30.title: Deepika Padukone meets & interacts with mental health patients, shares pics
30.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone and her mental health foundation Live Love Laugh's team interacted with mental health patients and their caregivers in rural areas of Tamil Nadu's Thiruvallur. Sharing pictures of her visit on Instagram, Deepika wrote, "Since our inception, we have been relentless in our efforts to improve the lives of those experiencing mental illness, as well as...their caregivers."

31.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra will bring back democracy in country: Cong's Mallu Ravi
31.article_body: Congress leader Mallu Ravi praised Rahul Gandhi for the Bharat Jodo Yatra, saying the campaign will restore the country's Constitution and democracy. "There is no freedom of speech and no freedom to question the government. Rahul Gandhi raised this issue in Parliament as there is no change in the attitude of the Centre and the TRS government," said Ravi.

32.title: Man pays woman to teach in his place at school in Gurugram; 3 held
32.article_body: A man who allegedly hired a woman to teach at a school in his place in Gurugram's Sector 54 was arrested by the CM's flying squad on Monday. The woman and the school headmaster were also arrested. The man, who did all this in connivance with the headmaster, used to pay the woman ₹8,000/month, DSP of CM's flying squad said.

33.title: It was very emotional: Abhishek on surprising Amitabh Bachchan on 'KBC 14'
33.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan said it was "very emotional" for him to be able to surprise Amitabh Bachchan and celebrate his 80th birthday on the sets of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14'. "It took a lot of secrecy, a lot of planning, hard work, and a lot of rehearsals to get it right. But then again, he deserves no less," Abhishek said.

34.title: Infosys to consider share buyback proposal on Thursday
34.article_body: Infosys will consider a proposal for a share buyback on Thursday. The IT major expects the buyback to be valued between ₹8,700 crore and ₹9,500 crore. Infosys completed its last share buyback of ₹9,200 crore in September 2021 and a one-year gap is a must between two buybacks. As of June end, its cash and equivalents were at ₹13,982 crore.

35.title: Delhi witnesses cleanest air day with AQI at 44 since August 2020
35.article_body: Delhi on Monday, with an air quality index (AQI) of 44 amid rains, witnessed its cleanest day in terms of air quality since August 2020. This comes a day after the national capital's AQI stood at 48 on Sunday. Delhi's AQI on August 31, 2020, was 41. "Once rains go away, AQI will once again start rising," an official said.

36.title: Bengaluru doctor's murder was preplanned, partner was having an affair: Police
36.article_body: A 27-year-old woman architect who was arrested last month in connection with the murder of her live-in partner, a Bengaluru-based doctor, had preplanned it, police said. "Our investigation revealed that she was having an affair with one of the accused," said police. The woman had alleged that she murdered the doctor after he uploaded her nude photographs and videos online.

37.title: B'luru autorickshaw drivers protest against ban on Ola, Uber, Rapido
37.article_body: Auto-rickshaw drivers in Bengaluru staged a protest outside a Regional Transport Office (RTO) on Monday against the government's order banning ride-hailing platforms Ola, Uber and Rapido. The drivers parked their vehicles and raised slogans against the ban. Notably, the Karnataka Transport Department has penalised some drivers associated with the ride-hailing platforms in the city.

38.title: Customer giving false info that I delayed order: Zomato agent in viral 'aarti' video
38.article_body: A Zomato delivery agent took to Twitter after a video of him being welcomed with an 'aarti' by a customer in Delhi went viral. The agent while sharing a screenshot of the order details, wrote, that through the video, the customer was spreading false information that he delayed their order. Commenting on his tweet, Zomato sought further details from him.

39.title: Streamer breaks her back after jumping into foam pit at TwitchCon in US, video surfaces
39.article_body: Streamer Adriana Chechik broke her back in two places after jumping into a foam pit at the TwitchCon gaming convention in US. A video of the incident surfaced on social media, where Chechik could be heard saying "I can't get up" after landing on the pit. Chechik said she's getting a "surgery to put a meter rod in for support".

40.title: India reports 1,957 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 27,374
40.article_body: India reported 1,957 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 2,654 people recovered in the last 24 hours, following which active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 27,374. The recovery rate in the country currently stands at 98.75%, while the daily positivity rate is at 0.71%.

41.title: I don't know: Dhanush's father on reports about actor calling off divorce with Aishwaryaa
41.article_body: Reacting to reports claiming that Dhanush and Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth are calling off their divorce, the actor's father said, "I don't know. My wife and I can live a good life even without the support of our children. The only expectation we have is for them to be happy." "We are happy when they are happy," he further said.

42.title: People are not going to tolerate an India where youths don’t have jobs: Rahul
42.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said the people of the country are not going to tolerate an India where millions of youngsters are without jobs. Furthermore, he added, "We are not going to tolerate an India where the vast majority of our people, millions and millions of people, are drowning under the weight of rising prices."

43.title: Pune police shares video of constable singing song 'Desh Mere'
43.article_body: Pune City Police on Monday shared a video of its constable Sagar Ghorpade singing the song 'Desh Mere' on Twitter, saying that there is "no need for a special day" to dedicate a song to the country. The song is from the movie 'Bhuj: The Pride of India'. A Twitter user reacted to the video, saying, "That's very beautiful."

44.title: Quitters never win, winners never quit: Vivek Agnihotri after Karan Johar quits Twitter
44.article_body: After Karan Johar announced that he's quitting Twitter and deleted his account, filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Quitters never win. Winners never quit." "I believe a genuine person seeking positive energies would leave Social Media completely. Leaving only Twitter because it doesn't allow hypocrisy or fakeness but staying on Instagram...is a negative and screwed up approach to life," he added.

45.title: Amitabh Bachchan isn't just a masterclass in acting, he's a feeling: Johar
45.article_body: Karan Johar on Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday said that the actor isn’t just a legend or a masterclass in acting, but a feeling "that trained minds to what a hero in cinema is and must always be". He called Amitabh a feeling "that defines cinema memories". "There'll be artists, megastars, celluloid masters...but there'll never be another Amitabh Bachchan," Johar added.

46.title: Boundaries are close to 30-yard circle in India, they're far bigger in Aus: Ashwin
46.article_body: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, on being asked about India's bowling concerns, said, "It's only fair to say the bowlers are getting hit around the park but we also need to understand the boundaries are very close to the 30-yard circle in India." He added, "[In] Australia, boundaries are far bigger, gives the bowlers a bit of licence to work with."

47.title: Vij recommends 3 officials' suspension during surprise inspection in Ambala
47.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij conducted a surprise inspection of a municipal council in Ambala on Monday and recommended the suspension of three officials over non-redressal of complaints. Vij also cross-checked the complaints with the applicants before taking action. At first, Vij inspected the room of the executive officer and then the record files at his private assistant's office.

48.title: Silicon Valley's wealthiest Russian Yuri Milner renounces citizenship amid war
48.article_body: Amid the ongoing war with Ukraine, Silicon Valley's richest Russian Yuri Milner said that he has renounced his citizenship after leaving the country in 2014. "My family and I left Russia for good in 2014," tweeted the billionaire. He's the founder of the internet investment firm DST Global. The Bloomberg Billionaires Index estimates Milner's wealth at about $3.5 billion.

49.title: Ukraine puts ex-Russian President Dmitry Medvedev on wanted list
49.article_body: Ukraine's Security Service (SBU) on Monday said ex-Russian President Dmitry Medvedev is on the country's wanted list. Medvedev, now Deputy Chairman of Russia's Security Council, is wanted under a section of the criminal code dealing with attempts to undermine Ukraine's territorial integrity and inviolability of its borders, the SBU added, saying, he was put on the list in March 2022.

50.title: Delhi Metro revises timings to facilitate India vs South Africa match spectators
50.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has decided to extend the last train timings today by 30-45 minutes on all its lines by providing an additional 48 trips to facilitate the spectators of cricket match between India and South Africa. The metro stations closest to the stadium are Delhi Gate metro station and ITO metro station, both on Violet Line.

51.title: Woman jumps into well with her 3 children in Bihar, all die
51.article_body: A woman and her three children, aged between three and eight, died after she allegedly jumped into a well along with them in Bihar's Kaimur, police said on Monday. The bodies of the woman and children were recovered after slippers worn by the children were found floating inside the well, according to an SHO. The woman's husband has been detained.

52.title: 1 dead, 1 rescued after being stuck on track on Kedarnath-Ransi trek
52.article_body: One person died while the other was rescued after the two were stuck on track during the Kedarnath-Ransi trek. The two had come to the trek as part of a group of 10 people, reports said. An SDRF spokesperson said that the tourists were found almost 6 km from Kedarnath, under heavy snowfall and harsh conditions.

53.title: Pawar to welcome Cong's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra: Reports
53.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar and his daughter Supriya Sule are likely to welcome Congress MP Rahul Gandhi when the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra campaign reaches Maharashtra on November 9. One of the NCP leaders said that Pawar's participation would send a message that the Opposition is united. The yatra was started on September 7 and has completed over 500 km.

54.title: 6 injured in clash over loud music near mosque in UP's Sultanpur
54.article_body: At least six persons, including a policeman, were injured following a clash between two communities over loud music near a mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur, police said. The incident took place during a Durga Puja immersion procession in the Baldirai area when it was passing at the time of 'azaan' from near a mosque, police added.

55.title: Jailed J&K separatist leader Altaf Ahmad Shah dies at AIIMS Delhi
55.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Altaf Ahmad Shah, jailed in an alleged terror funding case, died of cancer aged 66 at AIIMS, New Delhi on Tuesday. Shah, son-in-law of late Hurriyat leader Syed Ali Shah Geelani, was shifted to AIIMS following a Delhi High Court order. "Abu breathed his last at AIIMS, New Delhi. As a prisoner," Ruwa Shah, Altaf's daughter said.

56.title: We’ll take 'mashaal' to every home: Aaditya Thackeray on new poll symbol
56.article_body: After the Election Commission allotted the 'flaming torch' symbol to ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray’s faction, former state minister Aaditya Thackeray said that they will take the "mashaal" symbol to every home. "The new symbol, new name…we are extremely proud of Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray. He has worked as a CM, saving thousands of lives in Maharashtra," Aaditya said.

57.title: Man who threatened Ambani is frustrated about inflation, suffers from schizophrenia: Lawyer
57.article_body: Rakesh Kumar Mishra, a 30-year-old man from Bihar, who was arrested for threatening to kill industrialist Mukesh Ambani and his family, is mentally disturbed and has been suffering from chronic schizophrenia, his lawyer told the court. "He was frustrated about rising inflation and believed that the central government was favouring Reliance, hence he made threat calls to them," she added.

58.title: Was 13 when parents went through divorce; became difficult: 'Sacred...' actress
58.article_body: 'Sacred Games' actress Elnaaz Norouzi said that she was 13 when her parents were going through a divorce. "It became too difficult to deal with it on my own and so...I went for counselling and things became better. I went to the therapist for a very, very long time," she said, adding that she speaks to her therapist when needed.

59.title: Pune-based CA trying to book Goa hotel online cheated of ₹94,000
59.article_body: A 30-year-old CA professional from Pune was cheated of ₹94,000 while trying to book a hotel room in Goa online, said police. According to the victim, he dialled a number he found on a search engine and paid ₹25,000 as an initial booking amount. He was then asked to make additional payment to get the receipt.

60.title: India's Oscar entry Chhello Show's child actor Rahul Koli dies of cancer
60.article_body: Child actor Rahul Koli, who was a part of India's official Oscars 2023 entry 'Chhello Show', passed away earlier this month after battling leukaemia. Rahul's father Ramu Koli, who drives an auto-rickshaw for a living, said his son was looking forward to the film's release on October 14. "But he left us before that," Ramu added.

61.title: Raj Bhavan illuminated in pink light to spread breast cancer awareness in Hyd
61.article_body: Raj Bhavan was illuminated in pink light to spread breast cancer awareness in Hyderabad on Monday. Reports said that this is the third consecutive year that the Raj Bhavan has been illuminated. It is an initiative of the Ushalakshmi Breast Cancer Foundation headed by breast cancer surgeon, Dr P Raghu Ram, reports added.

62.title: Mandhana shares tips with Thailand Women after her 100th T20I game
62.article_body: India Women batter Smriti Mandhana was seen sharing batting tips with Thailand Women after their match in the ongoing Women's Asia Cup 2022. Notably, it was Mandhana's 100th T20I game and she's now only the second Indian woman cricketer to achieve the feat. In the game, India bundled out Thailand for just 37 runs and won by nine wickets.

63.title: Traffic restrictions in Delhi due to India vs South Africa ODI match today
63.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police imposed some traffic restrictions and diversions in view of the One Day International (ODI) cricket match between India and South Africa today at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. The police also advised travellers going to the Indira Gandhi International airport, Old Delhi and Nizamuddin railway stations, as well as ISBT to leave early to avoid delays.

64.title: Man stabs his estranged wife twice in Mumbai's Churchgate, arrested
64.article_body: The Churchgate Government Railway Police (GRP) have arrested a 39-year-old man for allegedly stabbing his estranged wife twice at the railway station in Mumbai. The woman has been admitted to Gokuldas Tejpal Hospital and her condition is reported to be critical. The accused is a welder by profession and stays in Palghar.

65.title: You're not doing any charity: SC to Raj govt over COVID ex-gratia compensation
65.article_body: Supreme Court told the Rajasthan government that it is not doing any charity after it filed its affidavit on steps to pay ex-gratia compensation to family members of COVID-19 victims. "Affidavit filed by Rajasthan government isn't satisfactory at all," SC added. It has been alleged that the Rajasthan government is not adhering to the 2021 order over COVID-19 ex-gratia compensation.

66.title: PayPal recalls policy to fine customers for misinformation after facing criticism
66.article_body: PayPal on Monday withdrew one of its policy updates that stated customers could be fined $2,500 for spreading misinformation, after facing criticism over it. The company apologised for it and said the policy update "went out in error that included incorrect information." Shares of the company were nearly 6% down after the update.

67.title: Love how she speaks her heart: Sushmita on Shreegauri Sawant
67.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen said she loves how transgender activist Shreegauri Sawant speaks her heart with "open, inclusive, aware, audacious and awe-inspiring clarity". Sushmita will be playing the lead role in the upcoming Shreegauri Sawant biopic, which is titled 'Taali'. "It's time to break barriers," Sushmita said, adding, "Here's to leaving our world less divided and an existence more united."

68.title: Army dog fights terrorists even after being shot twice in J&K; pic goes viral
68.article_body: An Army assault dog was on Monday critically injured during an encounter between security forces and terrorists in Anantnag district of Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. Army sent the dog named Zoom inside the house where the terrorists were holed up, officials added. Even after being shot twice, Zoom continued the task which resulted in neutralisation of two terrorists.

69.title: Germany to deliver air defence system to Ukraine 'within days'
69.article_body: Germany will deliver the first of four IRIS-T SLM air defence systems to Ukraine "within days", German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said. "The renewed missile fire on Kyiv and...other cities show how important it is to supply Ukraine with air defence systems quickly," Lambrecht added. "Russia's attacks with missiles and drones terrorise above all the civilian population," she further said.

70.title: Rajinikanth called Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' very interesting: Director
70.article_body: Director Mohan Raja shared that Rajinikanth watched 'GodFather' and found it "excellent" and "very interesting". The director described the praise from Rajinikanth as "one of the best moments" of his life. 'GodFather', starring Chiranjeevi and Nayanthara, is the Telugu remake of the Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. The original film starred Mohanlal in the lead role.

71.title: Pune's first underground metro station to be ready by November
71.article_body: The first underground metro station in Pune, being built at Shivajinagar, is 85% complete and will be ready by November, said Brijesh Dixit, MD of Maha Metro. However, it will be operational only after it gets clearance from the railway safety department, he added. The Pimpri Chinchwad to Swargate route will be underground from Shivajinagar to Swargate.

72.title: Over 60% complaints on Dial 112 from high-rise societies in GB Nagar
72.article_body: Over 60% of complaints on Dial 112 on a monthly average are from high-rise housing societies in Gautam Buddha Nagar, said officials. Maximum complaints from high-rise societies are of ruckus and fights between two groups, Dial 112 in-charge said. The helpline on an average gets over 550 complaints daily and over 17,000 complaints in a month, according to the data.

73.title: She's a miracle baby: Parineeti on Priyanka Chopra's daughter Malti
73.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra called her niece and Priyanka Chopra's daughter Malti Marie Chopra Jonas "a miracle baby". "She is so cute [that] I want to eat her...She is just a miracle baby. The most beautiful and the sweetest baby," Parineeti said, who is currently promoting 'Code Name: Tiranga'. Priyanka and Nick Jonas welcomed Malti via surrogacy in January 2022.

74.title: Dhawan is playing in a laid back manner, needs to show intent: Jaffer
74.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Shikhar Dhawan batted in a "laid back" manner during the two ODIs played so far against South Africa. "When we saw Dhawan in his purple patch, it looked like he played aggressively from the outset...Dhawan has to regain that intent," added Jaffer. Dhawan has scored 17 runs in the ongoing ODI series so far.

75.title: Huge crowd gathers at Mulayam Singh’s ancestral home in Saifai to pay tributes
75.article_body: People turned out in large numbers to pay their tributes to Samajwadi Party founder and former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav at his ancestral home in UP’s Saifai on Tuesday. Yadav’s last rites will be held today in Saifai at 3 pm. He passed away on Monday after undergoing treatment at Gurugram’s Medanta Hospital for a few days.

76.title: Delhi govt launches app to keep track of ongoing, upcoming projects
76.article_body: Delhi government has launched an app called 'Delhi E-Monitoring' to keep a track of all the ongoing and upcoming projects. "App has been launched for monitoring of projects/inspection/tasks [and will be] used by ministers and senior officers of all departments of Delhi government," a Public Works Department (PWD) official said. All departments have been asked to update data, officials said.

77.title: TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya arrested by ED in teacher recruitment scam
77.article_body: Trinamool Congress MLA Manik Bhattacharya has been arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in the teacher recruitment scam. He is the second TMC MLA to be arrested in the recruitment scam after Partha Chatterjee. Bhattacharya is the former Chairman of the state primary education board. He was removed from his post by the Calcutta High Court in June.

78.title: Google removes ad-free Instagram clone 'The OG App' from Play Store
78.article_body: Google has removed 'The OG App' from the Play Store, over a week after Apple pulled it down from the App Store. The app offered users an ad-free and suggestion-free Instagram feed, with an option to turn off Reels. "OG will be unable to continue serving users through...mobile app," the app's co-founders said after the removal.

79.title: She was 1st girl in family in long: 4-yr-old Delhi mishap victim's uncle
79.article_body: The uncle of the four-year-old girl who died after a building collapsed near Lahori Gate in Delhi, said that she was the first girl in the family in a long time. "Among us seven brothers, only he (girl's father) had a daughter. We were planning to celebrate her birthday next month," he said, adding their family has been badly affected.

80.title: Pune woman downloads electricity bill payment 'app', loses ₹7.66 lakh
80.article_body: A 65-year-old woman from Pune lost ₹7.66 lakh from her account as online fraudsters asked her to pay her electricity bill after making her download the "Electricity Quick support" application on her cell phone, police said. The victim claimed that she received a call from someone claiming to be an employee of Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited.

81.title: Won't share Nord Stream investigation findings with Russia: Sweden
81.article_body: Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson has said that Sweden won't share the findings of its probe into the explosions of Nord Stream 1 and 2 gas pipelines with Russia. Last week, Russian PM Mikhail Mishustin sent a letter to the Swedish government requesting that Russian authorities and the company Gazprom be involved in the Swedish investigation. Sweden had denied the request.

82.title: Hate speeches sullying India's atmosphere, need to be curbed: Supreme Court
82.article_body: Supreme Court has told a PIL petitioner who raised the issue of "governmental inaction" over "hate speeches" that she may be right in saying that hate speeches are sullying the country's atmosphere and need to be curbed. The CJI , however, said that the plea lacked specifics or detailed information and had only "vague" assertions.

83.title: Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan accused of breaking surrogacy laws; TN govt to probe
83.article_body: After actress Nayanthara and filmmaker Vignesh Shivan announced birth of twin sons, Tamil Nadu Minister Ma Subramanian said the state government will investigate the allegations that the couple violated surrogacy rules. "According to norms, those aged 21 years and under the age of 36 can donate oocytes. We presume this could have been done that way," the minister said.

84.title: Bodies of 2 B'luru mountaineers killed in U'khand avalanche found
84.article_body: The bodies of two mountaineers from Bengaluru who were killed in the recent avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district have been recovered, said officials. The victims were identified as 26-year-old Rakshith K and 33-year-old Vikram M. They were returning after completing a 28-day advanced mountaineering course at Uttarkashi-based Nehru Institute of Mountaineering.

85.title: India votes to reject Russia's demand for secret vote on Ukraine
85.article_body: India voted to reject Russia's demand to hold a secret vote in the UN General Assembly on whether to condemn Moscow's move to annex four partially occupied regions in Ukraine. India and over 100 other nations voted in favour of a recorded vote. Only 13 countries opposed holding a public vote.

86.title: Madonna appears to come out as gay at 64 in TikTok video
86.article_body: Singer Madonna seemingly came out as gay in a video posted on TikTok. In the video, the 64-year-old apparently holds a pair of pink panties with the caption on video stating, "If I miss...I'm gay." She then tosses the underwear towards a waste basket, intentionally misses and then gestures, "Oh well". “What in the 80s is happening?" a fan commented.

87.title: A bankruptcy moment: Zoho CEO on Bernanke winning Economics Nobel
87.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu called Ben Bernanke's Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences a "bankruptcy moment for central banking". The former US Federal Reserve Chair was awarded the Nobel for research on banks and financial crises. "Bernanke wins...at the very moment when...global financial system is...on the edge due to...misguided monetary policies he and other central bankers spearheaded," Vembu said.

88.title: Mumbai airport makes 100% switch to green energy sources
88.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) has entirely switched to green sources for its energy consumption needs, making it one of India's 100% sustainable airports, a CSMIA official said. Out of its total 100% needs, the airport procures around 5% of electricity requirement through solar energy and 95% from other green sources such as hydro and wind energy.

89.title: Delhi waives late payment fees on outstanding water bills till Dec 31
89.article_body: Delhi government will waive late payment fees on outstanding water bills till December 31, CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Monday. "You can pay your old outstanding bills without worrying about late fees," he tweeted. "To clean the Yamuna, three important projects approved today...55 MGD sewage pumping stations will be built on Badli, Nigam Bodh and Mori Gate drains," Kejriwal added.

90.title: Data Science recruiters don't look at your degree or experience: Scaler
90.article_body: To understand what companies are looking for when hiring data science professionals, Scaler interviewed 100+ data scientists from 50+ product tech companies. They're now consolidating the insights they gathered together in a free live class, it stated. People from a non-coding background looking to transition into the field of data science are welcome to attend this free class, Scaler added.

91.title: Dearness allowance for Jharkhand govt employees hiked to 38%
91.article_body: The Jharkhand cabinet on Monday approved a 4% hike in dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees and in dearness relief (DR) for its pensioners with effect from July 1 this year. DA for state government employees has been hiked from the existing 34% to 38%, an official said. Likewise, DR for pensioners has been hiked to 38%, she added.

92.title: Karnataka logs 109 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death
92.article_body: Karnataka reported 109 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 3.96% in the last 24 hours, the health department informed on Monday. Out of the fresh cases, 63 were logged in the Bengaluru Urban district, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. The lone fatality due to the infection in the state was recorded in the Uttara Kannada district.

93.title: Ishant relishing extra mentorship responsibilities: Delhi head coach
93.article_body: Delhi head coach Abhay Sharma said India bowler Ishant Sharma is relishing the extra responsibility of mentoring young pacers in the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy. "He can read the conditions better than anyone and...is sharing his knowledge...which is a very good sign for the team," said Abhay. He added that the team has put "ownership" responsibilities on senior players.

94.title: Brighton's 24-year-old midfielder Mwepu retires due to heart issue
94.article_body: Brighton's 24-year-old midfielder from Zambia, Enock Mwepu, has retired from football after being diagnosed with a hereditary heart condition. Brighton said Mwepu's condition wasn't previously evident on regular cardiac screening. Mwepu fell ill during the recent international break and after being admitted to a hospital in Mali, returned to Brighton for further tests which revealed his condition.

95.title: Qatar hires 3rd cruise ship to serve as fan hotel during FIFA World Cup
95.article_body: The FIFA World Cup organisers in Qatar have hired a third cruise ship to operate as a soccer fan hotel docked at Doha Port. Qatar does not have the hotel capacity for all those who will participate in the tournament and is coming up with solutions to deal with the same. The 1,075-cabin cruise will be available from November 19.

96.title: Hard to score against us in FIFA World Cup: India U-17 Women's head coach
96.article_body: India U-17 Women's head coach Thomas Dennerby said the team is hard to score against if it can execute its game plan properly. "If we utilise the chances we create, we can come out with points," said Dennerby. India will begin their FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup campaign against the USA at the Kalinga Stadium in Bhubaneswar on Tuesday.

97.title: La Nina caused excess rainfall in India in September: Report
97.article_body: Between June 1 and September 30, India recorded 925 mm of rain against the normal of 870 mm and above-average rainfall was reported for the fourth consecutive year. According to a report, the increased rainfall can be attributed to the La Nina conditions across the Pacific Ocean. Despite the majority of India recording excessive rains, 187 districts reported deficit rainfall.

98.title: Expect trade with India to cross $100 billion in 2 to 3 years: UAE
98.article_body: UAE's foreign trade minister Thani Bin Ahmed Al Zeyoudi said the UAE expects trade with India to cross $100 billion following the comprehensive economic partnership agreement signed in May 2022. The Indo-UAE trade stood at $73 billion, growing by 68% from last year. The total value of non-oil trade stood at $29.5 billion in first half of 2022.

99.title: Justices Chandrachud, Nazeer object to SC judges' selection process
99.article_body: Supreme Court judges Justices DY Chandrachud and Abdul Nazeer objected to the process of selection and appointment of judges by seeking views through the circulation of letters. Following this, the collegium headed by CJI UU Lalit aborted the process. Currently, there are five vacancies of judges in the apex court. The two judges didn't disclose any views about the candidates.

100.title: Blinken speaks to Azeri prez, welcomes release of Armenian POWs
100.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken on Monday spoke with Azeri President Ilham Aliyev about the "positive steps" Azerbaijan and Armenia are taking towards reaching a "sustainable peace agreement", a State Department readout said. Blinken also welcomed the release of 17 Armenian prisoners of war (POWs), the readout added. Armed fighting between the two countries last month killed over 200 people.

101.title: Indian space economy to reach $13 bn by 2025: Report
101.article_body: India's space economy is expected to be worth nearly $13 billion by 2025, according to a report released by the Indian Space Association (ISpA) and Ernst and Young. The satellite launch services segment will witness the highest growth due to government allowing participation of private players, the report added. In 2020, India's space economy was pegged at $9.6 billion.

102.title: Having skills without degree will be enough in the future: PM Modi
102.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while inaugurating an educational complex near Ahmedabad, said that only those societies that focus on education will succeed. "At the same time, I want to stress the importance of skill development as well. In the future, if a student does not have a degree but has some skill then it will be enough," the PM added.

103.title: Matthew Wade was out under the laws of cricket: Brad Hogg
103.article_body: Reacting to Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade pushing England pacer Mark Wood while the latter was going for a catch, ex-spinner Brad Hogg said that Wade was out under the laws of cricket. "[Jos] Buttler [was] put under extreme pressure to appeal...Umpires should be given the power to step in and make a correct decision in this situation," Hogg said.

104.title: Protests erupt over alleged RSS training in Coimbatore govt school
104.article_body: The Coimbatore Corporation Commissioner ordered an inquiry after activists protested in front of a government school alleging that RSS 'training' was organised there. The civic body said it had not given any permission for a meeting or training as activists shouted slogans. The RSS also reportedly denied holding any training in the school.

105.title: Akshay saved me from twisting my already injured leg: Juhi on 'Mr & Mrs Khiladi'
105.article_body: On the 25th anniversary of 'Mr & Mrs Khiladi', Juhi Chawla shared an anecdote from the shoot where Akshay Kumar saved her from twisting her already injured leg. "I'd...broken ligament," she wrote, adding, "Once while shooting...song 'Hum Total Fida Tumpe'...I slipped on...wet grass, and in a flash...Akshay was down beside me and saved me from twisting my leg again."

106.title: Deepika meets patients from TN village to mark World Mental Health Day
106.article_body: Deepika Padukone shared a post on Instagram marking World Mental Health Day. Ahead of the occasion, she visited rural areas in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur, where she interacted with beneficiaries, as well as their caregivers from her 'The Live Love Laugh Foundation'. "Expanding our rural outreach program is one...more important step towards making mental health care accessible...for all," she wrote.

107.title: India to emerge as hub of AI across the world: Piyush Goyal
107.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said that India is going to emerge as the hub of the artificial intelligence (AI) revolution across the world. He stated that government initiatives like Open Network for Digital Commerce and Government eMarketplace rely heavily on artificial intelligence. Goyal further added that AI can play a huge role in our day-to-day lives.

108.title: SC to hear ED's plea against bail to Anil Deshmukh tomorrow
108.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear the Enforcement Directorate's plea against the Bombay High Court's decision granting bail to former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a money laundering case. The matter was mentioned before a bench of Chief Justice UU Lalit and Justice SR Bhat. On Tuesday, a bench led by Justice DY Chandrachud will hear the matter.

109.title: NRI doctor donates her entire ₹20-crore wealth to Andhra government hospital
109.article_body: A US-based Andhra Pradesh native doctor has donated her entire wealth of ₹20 crore to a government hospital in her hometown of Guntur, reports said. Immunologist and allergy specialist Dt Uma Devi Gavini, who studied at Guntur Medical College in 1965, made the donation to Guntur Government General Hospital (GGH) recently.

110.title: 'Unacceptable escalation': UN chief on Russian strikes across Ukraine
110.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres has condemned Russian missile strikes that hit multiple Ukrainian cities on Monday, calling it an "unacceptable escalation of the war", according to his spokesperson. "The Secretary-General is deeply shocked by today's large-scale missile attacks," the spokesperson added. Ukraine claims that Russia fired at least 75 missiles as part of the widespread strikes.

111.title: 400 kg of donkey meat seized in Andhra Pradesh; accused arrested
111.article_body: Over 400 kg of donkey meat was seized by police in Andhra Pradesh's Bapatla district on Monday. All persons involved in the illegal trade of donkey meat and slaughter have been arrested. "Donkeys are sensitive animals who form deep bonds with their families and friends and communicate with each other through a variety of sounds," a PETA India official said.

112.title: Wife of Telangana CID DGP killed in car accident in Rajasthan
112.article_body: A woman was killed and two others were injured when the car they were travelling in overturned in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer district. The deceased, Sheela Singh Jatav (56), was the wife of Telangana's DGP (CID) Govind Singh. The accident happened after the passengers were returning from the Tanot Mata temple. The injured have been admitted to Jawahar Hospital, police said.

113.title: India Cements enter pact with JSW Cement to divest stake in Springway mining
113.article_body: India Cements announced that it has entered a pact with JSW Cement to divest its entire stake in Springway Mining Pvt Ltd (SMPL). Informing the stock exchanges, India Cements said that the total consideration for the deal was ₹476.87 crore. India Cements added that JSW Cement paid ₹373.87 crore as part of the deal to acquire the stake in SMPL.

114.title: Man high on magic mushrooms grabs flight attendant's breast, creates chaos on US flight
114.article_body: A man from US' Miami named Cherruy Sevilla created chaos on a Miami-Washington, DC United Airlines flight & attacked a flight attendant while being high on magic mushrooms, authorities stated. He allegedly "yelled, exhibited disturbing/uncontrolled behaviour". He also "grabbed and twisted" breast of a flight attendant, as per affidavit filed in US District Court for Eastern District of Virginia.

115.title: Katrina wanted to play ghost in 'Phone...', she was after me: Producer Farhan
115.article_body: Farhan Akhtar, producer of 'Phone Bhoot', spoke about the upcoming horror-comedy film at its trailer launch event and said Katrina Kaif's interest in the role of a ghost left him shocked. "Katrina was after me...She wanted to play a ghost. Even we were confused about how someone beautiful like Katrina can play a ghost," he added.

116.title: IIT Bombay adds non-engineering subjects for UG in curriculum overhaul
116.article_body: Subjects from management, entrepreneurship and design courses have been added to regular engineering curriculum for undergraduate students at IIT Bombay. Professor Kishore Chatterjee said the idea is to help students "become leaders in whichever path they choose." Students will have to select at least two to three courses from each basket alongside its core subjects and courses.

117.title: Paid true tribute to Sardar Patel by resolving Kashmir issue: PM
117.article_body: In an apparent dig at Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, PM Narendra Modi said "one person couldn't resolve the Kashmir issue" while Sardar Patel merged all other princely states. He added that he was able to find a solution as he is "following the footsteps" of Patel. The PM said he has paid 'true tributes to Sardar Patel by resolving the issue'.

118.title: 21-yr-old nursing student hangs herself in hostel room in UP
118.article_body: A 21-year-old nursing student died by suicide by hanging herself in her hostel room in Meerut, UP. The deceased has been identified as Arzoo, a BSc nursing student and a Delhi resident. Arzoo had been under stress and a suicide note was found, police said. Her mobile phone has been taken into custody by the police.

119.title: BJP govt helped improve India spot in ease of doing business list: PM
119.article_body: Speaking during a public rally in poll-bound Gujarat, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said that India's ranking in ease of doing business list has improved considerably after he took office in 2014, PTI reported. He added that BJP government has scrapped around 2,000 obsolete laws from the British-era that required industrialists to be sent to jail over minor issues.

120.title: Centre launches 24x7 tele-mental health service 'Tele-MANAS' in 20 states, UTs
120.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Monday launched a 24x7 tele-mental health service called Tele Mental Health Assistance and Networking Across States (Tele-MANAS) on the occasion of World Mental Health Day. The service will begin in 20 states and UTs and will subsequently be expanded across the country. The service can be accessed by calling helpline numbers 14416 and 1-800-891-4416.

121.title: How does the Cricket World Cup Super League table read after India's victory?
121.article_body: India are now fifth on the Cricket World Cup Super League points table after defeating South Africa in the second ODI. India have accumulated a total of 119 points. South Africa are placed 11th with 59 points. Top-seven ranked teams and World Cup hosts (India) will automatically qualify for 2023 World Cup.

122.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states for next few days, list released
122.article_body: IMD stated heavy to very heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh on October 11. Heavy rainfall is likely over Uttar Pradesh, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Telangana on October 11. Karnataka, West Bengal, Bihar, Sikkim, Assam and Meghalaya may witness heavy rainfall on October 11 and 12. Tamil Nadu and Puducherry may get it from October 11 to 14.

123.title: US recession likely in 6 to 9 months from now: JPMorgan CEO
123.article_body: America's largest bank JPMorgan Chase's CEO Jamie Dimon on Monday said that the US could tip into a recession in six to nine months from now. He cited runaway inflation, big interest rate hikes and the Russian invasion of Ukraine as the indicators of a potential recession. He also cited the unknown effects of the US Fed's quantitative easing policy.

124.title: Big B is 80 going on 20, he kept asking questions on sets: Parineeti
124.article_body: Speaking about veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan, actress Parineeti Chopra said, "Bachchan sir is like, I mean it with all my love and respect, he is 80 going on 20." She added that Amitabh has a student's mind. Amitabh and Parineeti will feature in Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai'. "When I see him on set, he is constantly asking questions," she added.

125.title: IDBI Bank's privatisation process likely to conclude by September 2023: Report
125.article_body: According to a report, the privatisation process of IDBI bank is expected to conclude by September 2023. The financial bids for the sale will be invited by March next year. Last week, the government along with the Life Insurance Corporation invited preliminary bids for selling 60.72% stake in IDBI Bank. The deadline to submit Expression of Interest is December 16.

126.title: Record 5.4 lakh vehicles sold during Navratri in 2022: FADA
126.article_body: Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) on Monday said the vehicle retail sales in the country rose 57% during the Navratri festival this year. According to FADA, India reported a record sales of nearly 5.4 lakh vehicles between September 26 and October 5, 2022. Two-wheeler retail sales in this year's Navratri festival reported a growth of 52.35% to 3,69,020 units.

127.title: 'Doctor G' makers organise special screening for doctors in Mumbai
127.article_body: The makers of Ayushmann Khurrana and Rakul Preet Singh-starrer 'Doctor G' recently organised a special screening for doctors in Mumbai. According to reports, over 50 doctors along with their family members attended the screening. Directed by Anubhuti Kashyap, 'Doctor G' will be released on October 14. The comedy-drama film also stars Shefali Shah and Sheeba Chadha.

128.title: Coal Ministry issues allocation order for 12 coal mines
128.article_body: Ministry of Coal has issued allocation orders for 12 coal mines for which the Coal Mine Development and Production Agreement was signed on August 17. The mines are expected to generate annual revenue of ₹3,569 crore and attract capital investment of ₹3,208 crore. The cumulative Peak Rated Capacity of the mines is 21 million tonnes per annum.

129.title: How can an animated film be called big movie?: Tammareddy on 'Adipurush'
129.article_body: Speaking about 'Adipurush', Telugu filmmaker Tammareddy Bharadwaj has said that he does not understand how an animated film can be called a big movie. "A huge hype was created on the film as it was said...the film is being made with ₹500 crore. But the teaser was very disappointing," he added. 'Adipurush' was trolled over its VFX on Twitter.

130.title: Adani Ports gets NCLT nod to acquire remaining 58.1% stake in Gangavaram Port
130.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) received approval from the NCLT to acquire the remaining 58.1% stake in Gangavaram Port Limited (GPL) via the composite scheme of arrangement. The acquisition involves 517 million shares at ₹120 per share amounting to ₹6,200 crore and will be done through a share swap arrangement. GPL is located next to Vizag Port.

131.title: Need thorough law for job security of those going abroad: Kerala CM
131.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has called for comprehensive immigration law to ensure job security and the welfare of persons going abroad for employment. He added that it was not the policy of the state government to send everyone abroad and it instead aims to create a "new Kerala". Vijayan said he wanted to make Kerala a higher education hub.

132.title: Beauty parlour operator raped at gunpoint in UP; man booked
132.article_body: A beauty parlour operator in Muradnagar town in UP's Ghaziabad district was allegedly raped at gunpoint by a man. The accused came in contact with the victim through a pamphlet which she had distributed for the parlour's publicity, police said. The accused also allegedly shot a video and threatened to make it viral if the victim went against him.

133.title: Indian Navy's 1st Training Squadron arrives at Dubai's Port Rashid
133.article_body: Three ships of the Indian Navy's 1st Training Squadron (1TS) entered Dubai's Port Rashid on Monday as part of a long-range training deployment. INS Tir, INS Sujata and Coast Guard Ship Sarathi were received by India's Defence Attache and UAE Navy officials. "The deployment...is aimed at exposing...trainees to...conduct of various evolutions at sea and port familiarization," Defence Ministry said.

134.title: Tracxn Technologies' ₹309.38 crore IPO subscribed 13% on Day 1
134.article_body: Tracxn﻿ Technologies, a Bengaluru-based market data startup, launched its initial public offering on Monday. The IPO was subscribed 13% on the first day of bidding, Times Now reported. The portion set aside for retail investors was subscribed 0.71 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 0.01 times. Tracxn﻿ Technologies has set its price band at ₹75-₹80 apiece for IPO.

135.title: Ajay Devgn announces film with Neeraj Pandey, to release in 2023
135.article_body: Ajay Devgn took to Twitter to announce his upcoming project with filmmaker Neeraj Pandey. He added that the film will release in theatres on June 16, 2023. Neeraj is known for directing films like 'Baby', 'Special 26' and 'A Wednesday'. Ajay will next be seen in 'Thank God', which is set to release on October 25.

136.title: West didn't give us weapons for decades: Jaishankar on India buying Russian weapons
136.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar defended India's "substantial inventory" of Russian-origin weapons saying there are "a variety of reasons" behind it. "For decades, western countries didn't supply weapons to India," said Jaishankar. Western nations saw "a military dictatorship next to us as the preferred partner", he said in an apparent reference to Pakistan.

137.title: Lot of bad feelings in me back then: Aubameyang on video criticising Arteta
137.article_body: Chelsea forward Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang clarified that the video of him criticising Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta was in the past. "At the time I still had a lot of bad feelings in me...I wish all my old guys well," said Aubameyang. The video showed former Arsenal striker Aubameyang saying that Arteta "can't deal" with "big characters and big players".

138.title: 'Flaming torch' election symbol will make Shiv Sena stronger: Raut
138.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena's new election symbol, 'flaming torch', will make the party stronger in future. "Earlier, symbols of Jansangh and Congress were also frozen...Those parties also got bigger after the new symbols. We will grow," Raut said. Election Commission has also allotted the name 'Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray)' to the Thackeray-led faction.

139.title: Heard people call us 'B' side, I was really upset: Ishan Kishan on India squad for SA ODIs
139.article_body: Talking about Team India squad for the ongoing ODI series against South Africa being termed as "second-string side" by many, wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan said, "I heard people call us the 'B' side. I was really upset." He added, "We wanted to play our A game (in second ODI)...Everybody is in their prime form and hopefully we'll win the third ODI."

140.title: Goa bars, restaurants to provide cabs to customers in drunken state
140.article_body: The Goa government is planning to make it compulsory for bar and restaurant owners to arrange cabs for their customers in drunken state to drop them home or in hotels, in case of tourists. "This is a new norm in Goa for the safety of people. We will implement it very strictly," state Transport Minister Mauvin Godinho said.

141.title: Done with rookie drivers for the foreseeable future: Haas F1 boss
141.article_body: Haas F1 boss Guenther Steiner said he was "done" with rookies "for the foreseeable future" with regards to his team's 2023 drivers' line-up. "Need to see what is best for the team or...who is the best driver," said Steiner. He added they did not want to be thinking "we did this too quick" when it comes to 2023 drivers.

142.title: Amazon-backed Rivian recalls nearly all its EVs; its shares fall 9%
142.article_body: Amazon-backed EV-maker Rivian on Friday recalled nearly all its 13,000 vehicles due to a possible loose fastener that could cause the driver to lose steering control. Following the recall, which sparked concerns that the EV-maker may not meet its 2023 production target, Rivian's shares fell about 9% on Monday. Rivian had cut its 2022 production target by half in March.

143.title: Ex-Delhi minister to be questioned by police over conversion event
143.article_body: The Delhi Police has issued a notice to AAP leader Rajendra Pal Gautam to appear for questioning in connection with a religious conversion event on Tuesday. He quit the Delhi Cabinet on Sunday amid controversy over his participation in the event. Delhi Police officials said the notice has been issued to know all details.

144.title: Finance Minister Sitharaman to attend IMF, World Bank annual meetings in US
144.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will attend the annual meetings of IMF and World Bank during her six-day visit to US, starting October 11. She will also attend the meetings of the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors. The minister would also meet US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and World Bank President David Malpass separately.

145.title: S Jaishankar gifts bat signed by Virat Kohli to Deputy PM of Australia, he shares pic
145.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar gifted a bat signed by Virat Kohli to Deputy PM of Australia Richard Marles. Sharing a picture on Twitter, Marles wrote, "A pleasure to host @DrSJaishankar here in Canberra. There are many things which bind us, including our love of cricket. Today, he surprised me with a signed bat from cricket legend...@imVkohli."

146.title: Aviation Minister Scindia announced projects worth ₹2,361 crore for J&K
146.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday announced projects worth ₹2,361 crore for Jammu and Kashmir (J&K). Scindia said that a Civil Enclave (Airport) worth ₹861 crore will come up at Jammu. Further, the minister said that Srinagar's present terminal will be expanded three times from 20,000 square metres to 60,000 square metres at a cost of ₹1,500 crore.

147.title: 2 local LeT terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Anantnag
147.article_body: Two local terrorists belonging to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) were killed in an encounter with security forces in J&K's Anantnag district on Monday, police informed. Two soldiers and an Army dog were injured in the operation, the Indian Army said. The encounter broke out after terrorists opened fire at security forces personnel during a search operation in the Tangpawa area, police added.

148.title: 12 die in rain-related incidents across UP; CM orders relief work
148.article_body: At least 12 people died in rain-related incidents across Uttar Pradesh between 10 pm on Sunday to 5 pm on Monday. Five of the total deaths were caused by the collapse of house walls, while three persons died by snake bite, two by lightning and one by drowning. CM Yogi Adityanath has directed officials to carry out relief operations.

149.title: I'm exhausted with questions about my body transformation: Shehnaaz
149.article_body: During her appearance on the show 'Bingo! Comedy Adda Season 2', host Varun Sharma asked Shehnaaz Gill about her body transformation. To this, she replied, "I've become exhausted answering this question about my physique." Shehnaaz added she can feel the extra weight after eating something "delicious" despite controlling her diet for a week. "My body doesn't...listen to me," she stated.

150.title: It's a picnic: Sumeet Vyas on working with 'Tripling' co-stars Maanvi, Amol
150.article_body: Sumeet Vyas, speaking about working on web show 'Tripling', said, "The two months of shooting and rehearsal are something that I...look forward to because it's a...small unit of six actors." "We've...known each other for many years...so it's...a picnic for us to meet each other," he added. The show also stars Maanvi Gagroo and Amol Parashar, among others, in pivotal roles.

151.title: Sourav Ganguly-backed Flickstree raises $5 mn in pre-Series B round
151.article_body: AI startup Flickstree has raised $5 million in its pre-Series B funding round led by Venture Catalysts Group. Founded in 2016 by Saurabh Singh, Rahul Jain and Nagendra Sandra, Flickstree is a content-led video commerce platform enabling transactions for brand partners, leveraging in-house video content created with patented AI. The platform was backed by Sourav Ganguly in 2017.

152.title: PhonePe founders acquire Mumbai team in Prime Volleyball League
152.article_body: Payments startup PhonePe Co-founders Sameer Nigam and Rahul Chari have acquired the Mumbai Meteors franchise in the Prime Volleyball League (PVL). Former Indian volleyball team captain Abhijit Bhattacharya has been appointed as the General Manager of the Mumbai Meteors. Sameer Nigam said that he is a regular volleyball player and is excited about this opportunity.

153.title: Flipkart & Samsung announce 'crazy' price drop on Samsung Galaxy Z Flip3
153.article_body: Flipkart has revealed that Samsung's flagship foldable smartphone, Galaxy Z Flip3, is available for ₹59,999 only during its Big Diwali Sale. This was announced during Flipkart's live event 'FlipAtFlipkart' on 'The Zero Hour'. Exchange offers make the price even more lucrative, Flipkart shared. No-cost EMI is available for 12 months. The Big Diwali Sale goes live tonight, October 11.

154.title: Haryana man promises '3 airports, free makeup kits' in Sarpanch manifesto
154.article_body: Bhai Jaikaran Lathwal from Haryana's Sarsadh village promised "three airports, no GST and free makeup kits" in his Sarpanch election manifesto. A picture of his manifesto, which promises petrol at ₹20/litre, a metro line from the village to Delhi, free Wi-Fi service and alcohol bottles for addicts, has gone viral. "I'm shifting to this village," a Twitter user wrote.

155.title: Bank of Maharashtra raises lending rate by 20 bps; EMIs to go up
155.article_body: The Bank of Maharashtra (BoM) on Monday raised its marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 20 basis points to 7.80% across different tenors. The benchmark one-year MCLR, which was 7.60% till now, will now be 7.80% from Monday, October 10, 2022. As a result of the hike revision, housing, vehicle and personal loans will become more costlier.

156.title: Don't know if someone in B'wood wants to work with me: Pak actor Fawad Khan
156.article_body: Pakistani actor Fawad Khan has said he does not know if someone in Bollywood wants to work with him. "I'll do my work and go away but then the people who'll have to suffer are those who want to collaborate with me," he added. Karan Johar's 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil' was Fawad's last appearance in a Bollywood film.

157.title: Is PM Modi campaigning for Congress in Gujarat: Kejriwal
157.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi cautioned BJP workers against taking Congress lightly in the upcoming state Assembly elections, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked if PM Modi is campaigning for Congress in Gujarat. "Congress is trying to infiltrate with a new strategy. It does not speak but is reaching out to villages [by] holding meetings," PM Modi told the BJP workers.

158.title: L'Oréal to pay ₹186.4 cr profit it collected after 10% GST rate cut in 2017
158.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday directed L'Oréal India to pay ₹186.39 crore profit it collected after the government introduced a reduction in GST rates from 28% to 18% in November 2017. L'Oréal will submit the profiteered amount to Consumer Welfare Fund in six equal instalments. A probe had found L'Oréal didn't pass profiteered amount on products like shampoos and conditioners.

159.title: Avoid non-essential travel: Advisory for Indians in Ukraine amid Russian strikes
159.article_body: Amid an escalation in the Ukraine-Russia conflict on Monday, the Indian embassy in Kyiv advised all Indian nationals there to "avoid all non-essential travel to and within Ukraine". "They (Indians) must strictly follow the safety and security guidelines...They're requested to keep the Embassy informed about the status of their presence in Ukraine," said the embassy.

160.title: HC closes all cases against Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain under Benami Act
160.article_body: Delhi HC on Monday closed all proceedings against Delhi Minister and AAP leader Satyendar Jain under the Benami Transactions (Prohibition) Amendment Act. Jain's counsel had claimed the Benami proceedings against him had nature of political persecution. Reacting to HC's order, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "How good it'd be if they use time for nation-building rather than filing fake cases."

161.title: He said, 'You'll be PM again': PM Modi recalls Mulayam Singh's 2019 Lok Sabha speech
161.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing a rally in Gujarat's Bharuch, recalled Mulayam Singh Yadav's 2019 speech wherein the late leader had praised him. "He (Mulayam Singh) said 'Modi ji takes everyone along and that's why I know he will be elected as the PM again'," recalled PM Modi. "What a big heart one must have (to say this)," he added.

162.title: Forcing employees to keep webcam on is violation of human rights: Dutch court
162.article_body: A Dutch court ruled that forcing employees to keep webcam on is violation of human rights. The court was hearing a case where a remote Dutch employee was fired by a US company for not keeping his webcam on. The court stated demanding webcam surveillance is in conflict with the respect of workers' privacy and it's a human rights violation.

163.title: Heat from fingertips can be used to crack passwords in seconds: Researchers
163.article_body: A research by the University of Glasgow researchers shows computer and smartphone users' passwords can be guessed in seconds by analysing the heat their fingertips leave on keyboards and screens. They trained an AI model to effectively read the images and make guesses about the passwords. Their system revealed 86% of passwords when thermal images are taken within 20 seconds.

164.title: Tamil Nadu govt allows bursting of less-polluting crackers on Diwali
164.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Monday allowed the bursting of firecrackers with certain restrictions on Diwali. Only less-polluting and low sound-generating crackers will be allowed during two fixed-time windows, from 6 am to 7 am and from 7 pm to 8 pm. People have been asked to seek permission from district administration or local bodies concerned for community fire cracking.

165.title: Don't lose focus, we need cooperation to save country: Tejashwi
165.article_body: RJD Chairperson Tejashwi Yadav asked his party members to iron out the differences between them. "We may not like each other...Despite our differences, I would like to request...please do not lose focus of the larger picture," Tejashwi said. He added, "We need everyone's cooperation to save the country...Such small fights will put us on the defensive."

166.title: Taiwan's 'insistence on independence' root cause of tensions: China
166.article_body: The root cause of tensions in the Taiwan Strait is the Taiwanese government's "insistence on...independence", the Chinese foreign ministry said on Monday, adding that Taiwan is an inseparable part of China's territory. The remark came as a response to Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen's speech where she said that a war between Taiwan and China is "absolutely not an option".

167.title: Keep inspiring us with cinematic brilliance: Mahesh on Rajamouli's b'day
167.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu took to Twitter and wished 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli on his 49th birthday. He tweeted, "Keep inspiring us with your cinematic brilliance! Happiness and success always!" Mahesh will be working with Rajamouli on an untitled project soon. 'RRR' actor Jr NTR tweeted, "Happy Birthday Jakkanna @ssrajamouli!! Wishing you the best as always."

168.title: Shiv Sena Uddhav faction gets new name, 'flaming torch' election symbol
168.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) has allotted the name 'Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray)' and the 'flaming torch' symbol to former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's faction for the Andheri East bypoll. The Eknath Shinde-led faction, which will fight the election under the name 'Balasahebanchi Shiv Sena', has been asked to submit a new list of symbols by 10 am on Tuesday.

169.title: 2 trekkers stranded at Kalihani Pass of Himachal Pradesh rescued
169.article_body: Two trekkers stranded at Himachal Pradesh's Kalihani Pass were rescued by a seven-member team, Kullu district administration said on Monday. "One of the trekkers...suffered from snow blindness and had to be carried all the way down," a senior official said. "The trekkers had run out of food after they took refuge under a rock for three days," he added.

170.title: US firm fires Dutch employee over webcam, court awards him money more than his 1-yr salary
170.article_body: A remote Dutch employee of a US company, who was fired for refusing to leave his webcam on while he was working, has been awarded around €75,000 by a Dutch court for "wrongful termination". The employee had alleged his termination was disproportionate, and the demand to leave his webcam turned on contravened data privacy rules. He was earning over €70,000/year.

171.title: 5 tribals beaten up for taking picture of Durga idol in Jharkhand
171.article_body: Five tribals were beaten up allegedly by a village head and others for taking a photograph of a Durga idol in Jharkhand's Garhwa, police said. The man who took the picture was also tonsured. "When I was taking picture of a Durga idol on the immersion day, I was driven out of Puja mandap by some men," the man said.

172.title: I should retire after having worked with Alia, Deepika, Katrina: Siddhant
172.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said he should retire from acting after having worked with actresses Alia Bhatt, Deepika Padukone and Katrina Kaif. Siddhant, who starred in 'Gully Boy' with Alia and 'Gehraiyaan' with Deepika, will next feature with Katrina in 'Phone Bhoot'. "They are...the most celebrated [actresses] in modern times....it's an honour for me to work with all...of them," he added.

173.title: Anand Pandit pledges 8,000 meals in orphanages on Big B's 80th b'day
173.article_body: To mark Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, producer Anand Pandit has pledged to distribute 8,000 meals in orphanages across Mumbai and Gujarat. He'll also be donating 800 hearing aids to senior citizens and kids in Mumbai. "Completing eight 'parikramas' around...earth with such joy...is no small milestone and I wanted to make a special gesture to celebrate this momentous day," Anand said.

174.title: UK sanctions Iran's morality police 'in its entirety'
174.article_body: The UK on Monday announced it has sanctioned Iran's "Morality Police in its entirety".
