He was widely admired as a humble and grounded leader who was sensitive to people's problems."

349.title: Apple's new Crash Detection feature alerts 911 when users ride rollercoasters: Report
349.article_body: Apple's new Crash Detection feature, which is supposed to alert authorities on detecting its user being in a car accident, is reportedly getting triggered by rollercoasters. As per a report, the feature is alerting 911 in the US when the user rides a rollercoaster. Apple rolled out the feature in iPhone 14, Watch Series 8, SE, and Ultra last month.

350.title: BJP should start preparing to be part of Opposition: Tharoor
350.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said BJP should start preparing to be a part of the Opposition ahead of the general elections in 2024. "Congress has run the country nicely, we have experienced people…We need to show our strength to re-win voters," Tharoor added. "Party...needs to be confident so voters may give us their trust," he stated.

351.title: Irreparable loss: Congress on Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise
351.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, the Congress party tweeted, "It is an irreparable loss for Indian politics." The tweet further read, "May God give him a place at his feet and give strength to his family and supporters to bear this loss." The three-time ex-UP CM had been in the hospital for several days.

352.title: India reports 2,424 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 28,079
352.article_body: India reported 2,424 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. A decline of 514 COVID-19 cases was recorded in a span of last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 28,079. The death toll climbed to 5,28,814 with 15 fatalities in last 24 hours.

353.title: Man shares pic of 'yellow paper' inside samosa served on train; IRCTC replies
353.article_body: A passenger travelling in Bandra bound Lucknow weekly express shared pictures of a samosa he bought on train and complained that he found a yellow paper inside it. "I salute IRCTC for the food [it's] serving," the man tweeted. IRCTC replied that the matter is being taken up, adding, "Sir, inconvenience regretted. Kindly share pnr and mobile no in DM."

354.title: 2 killed, 2 more rescued from debris as wall collapses at Mohali construction site
354.article_body: Two dead bodies were retrieved and two more persons were rescued from debris hours after a wall of an under-construction showroom at Mohali City Centre collapsed on Sunday evening. Earlier, one dead body and four persons were taken out of the wall's debris. The showroom is being constructed on the Mohali airport road.

355.title: 3 including 4-yr-old girl killed after building collapses near Delhi's Lahori Gate
355.article_body: Three people, including a four-year-old girl, were killed after a building collapsed near Delhi's Lahori Gate on Sunday. Officials said that efforts are on to locate and rescue those who could still be trapped under debris. A total of 11 people were reported injured after two more people were rescued on Monday morning.

356.title: 1 dead, 6 injured in shooting outside bar in US' Florida after fight breaks out
356.article_body: A shooting outside a bar in downtown Tampa, Florida, on early Sunday morning has left one dead and injured six others. According to police, a verbal altercation took place between two large groups inside the lounge. They were escorted outside, when a suspect retrieved a gun and fired multiple shots, injuring four adult males and two adult females, police added.

357.title: Delhi Police asks commuters to avoid road between Ashram chowk and Kilokri village
357.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police issued a traffic advisory and warned commuters that there will be heavy traffic on both the carriageways between Ashram chowk and Kilokri village due to flyover construction work in the area. The construction work will continue till the first week of December, the traffic police added. The police further advised commuters to avoid this stretch.

358.title: Man stabbed to death in Delhi's Budh Bazar; 1 person arrested
358.article_body: A person was arrested for allegedly stabbing a man to death in Delhi's Budh Bazar, police said on Sunday. The incident occurred after the accused, Ankit, along with a few others stopped a motorcycle on which the deceased, Faraz, was travelling, police added. The suspects managed to escape from the scene and police have set up teams to catch them.

359.title: Putin accuses Ukraine of planning bridge blast, calls it 'terrorism'
359.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday accused Ukrainian special services of devising, carrying out and ordering the blast on a key bridge linking Russia and Crimea. "This is an act of terrorism aimed at destroying...important civilian infrastructure," he said. Security Council Deputy Chairman Dmitry Medvedev said that Russia "can only respond to this crime by directly killing terrorists".

360.title: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav passes away at 82
360.article_body: The founder of the Samajwadi Party (SP) Mulayam Singh Yadav has passed away aged 82 in Haryana's Gurugram. The three-time former UP CM was admitted to the ICU ward and reportedly put on a ventilator at Medanta Hospital last week after his health deteriorated. Yadav, who was also India's former Defence Minister, had been in the hospital for several days.

361.title: BJP creates tension between Hindus & Muslims: Owaisi
361.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday said, "BJP doesn't have anything to show except to create tension between Hindus and Muslims." Furthermore, Owaisi said, "I have full faith that the BJP will remain at number three in Telangana. They have no policy except to change the names." On Sunday, Owaisi criticised BJP for renaming Tipu Express.

362.title: Ravana seized bow and arrow of Lord Ram: Uddhav after EC freezes symbol
362.article_body: Days after the Election Commission froze the bow and arrow symbol of the Shiv Sena, former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that the 40-headed Ravana froze the bow and arrow of Lord Ram. "I believe in the judiciary. We will get justice...You stabbed your mother in the chest. Do not use Balasaheb's name," said Uddhav.

363.title: Urmila Matondkar to star in Marathi film 'Ti Me Navhech': Report
363.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar will reportedly be making her comeback to Marathi films after eight years with 'Ti Me Navhech'. As per a report, the film will see Urmila sharing screen space with actor Shreyas Talpade. The project will be helmed by theatre actor-director-writer Paritosh Painter. It is scheduled to go on floors in February 2023 in London.

364.title: Unfortunate that I missed on 100, but happy that we won: Ishan on 93(84)
364.article_body: Talking about his 93(84) in the second ODI against South Africa, Ishan Kishan said, "Unfortunately, I missed on century...[but] I'm just happy that [we] won." Ishan added, "I'll give my best and make [India] win again [in the final ODI]." Ishan and Shreyas added 161 runs for the third wicket as India chased down SA's 278-run total in 45.5 overs.

365.title: Expected pitch to get slower but it got better: Maharaj on 2nd ODI
365.article_body: South Africa stand-in captain Keshav Maharaj said they expected the pitch to get slower and lower, having opted to bat after winning the toss in the second ODI against India. "[However] it got easier to bat after the 30th over due to the...dew," added Maharaj. "We didn't expect the dew to play such a big part," he stated.

366.title: Noida, Greater Noida authorities plan e-bike service for commuters
366.article_body: The Noida and Greater Noida authorities are planning to start electric bike service soon on rent at all metro stations and other busy public areas. "Many expert agencies are showing interest in taking the e-bike project," a senior official said. The authority has decided to procure 350 e-bikes that commuters can rent at a cost of ₹2 per minute.

367.title: Kanye West's Twitter account locked a day after his return over anti-Semitic tweet
367.article_body: Twitter has locked and restricted rapper Kanye West's account for violating site policies and deleted a tweet which invoked anti-Jewish stereotypes. The action was taken just one day after West returned to the social media platform for the first time in nearly two years. Earlier, Instagram removed content from West's account and placed restrictions on it following repeated policy violations.

368.title: Rupee hits new record low of 82.67 against US dollar
368.article_body: The Indian rupee touched a new record low on Monday after having breached the 82-mark against the US dollar for the first time ever on Friday. On Monday, the rupee opened at 82.67 against the dollar as compared to Friday's close of 82.33. Notably, the rupee has lost over 10% of its value this year.

369.title: Pune RTO to start special drive against private tourist buses
369.article_body: Pune RTO has now decided to start a special drive to check all tourist bus operations ahead of Diwali. It will form special squads to keep tabs on passenger seating capacity, fares, etc. "Our appeal to the public is to travel safely and register a complaint with the RTO if they face any issue," an RTO officer said.

370.title: Schools to be shut in Noida, Ghaziabad today due to heavy rainfall
370.article_body: Schools will remain shut in Noida and Ghaziabad today due to heavy rainfall. Schools have also been shut in Kanpur, Aligarh, Agra, Lucknow, Hapur and Meerut. The decision will be applicable to students up to class 12. "All the principals and headmasters should ensure compliance with the order," District School Inspector Dharamveer Singh said.

371.title: Beaten by teacher for failing test, 12-yr-old Noida boy dies in hospital
371.article_body: A 12-year-old class five student died while undergoing treatment after he was allegedly beaten by his teacher for failing a test in Noida. However, police said that the student was unwell that day and therefore, the exact reason for death has not been ascertained. The teacher was allegedly present with the family at the hospital until the boy died.

372.title: Many BJP workers secretly support AAP in Gujarat: Kejriwal
372.article_body: Many BJP leaders and workers in Gujarat secretly support AAP and want to see the defeat of their own party in the upcoming Assembly elections, Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said on Sunday. "After 27 years, people want hope because they got nothing but corruption and misgovernance in all these years," Kejriwal said at a rally.

373.title: Katrina may look innocent, but she’s a prankster: Siddhant Chaturvedi
373.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said his 'Phone Bhoot' co-star Katrina Kaif "might look innocent, but she's a prankster". Siddhant also called Katrina "one of the most hardworking actresses" he's worked with. "It was fun working with her. She was very loving. Got to learn a lot from her," he said. 'Phone Bhoot' also stars Ishaan Khatter.

374.title: It’s off the table: Dwayne Johnson on 2024 US Presidential run
374.article_body: Actor Dwayne Johnson has confirmed that the idea of running for the 2024 US Presidential elections is "off the table". Johnson shared that he's been approached by "most influential" political personalities "asking and supporting" him to run for President. But while he's grateful for the opportunity, Dwayne said, "I'm not a politician nor have I ever aspired to be one."

375.title: No desire to be involved in wars: Musk after his proposals on Ukraine-Russia, China-Taiwan
375.article_body: After suggesting a possible peace deal to end the war between Russia and Ukraine and to diffuse China-Taiwan tensions, the world’s richest person Elon Musk remarked, "I have no desire to become involved in wars." Responding to a Twitter user, Musk added, "But it is safe to say that all bets are off if the nukes start flying."

376.title: What father earned, Uddhav lost in minutes: NCP's Khadse on Sena symbol freeze
376.article_body: Referring to the freezing of Shiv Sena's name and symbol by the Election Commission, NCP leader Eknath Khadse said, "What the father had earned with a lot of difficulties is lost by the son in minutes in [a] political fight." Khadse added, "Uddhav Thackeray came to power with this symbol but everything is lost now in the fight."

377.title: Lena Headey, known for playing Cersei in 'Game of Thrones', marries for 3rd time
377.article_body: Actress Lena Headey, best known for playing Cersei Lannister in 'Game of Thrones', has married actor Marc Menchaca in a private ceremony in Italy. This is Lena's third wedding as she was previously married to musician Peter Paul Loughran and director Dan Cadan. GoT actors Peter Dinklage, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Emilia Clarke, Sophie Turner and Conleth Hill attended the wedding.

378.title: Sushmita Sen was my first choice: Shreegauri Sawant on her biopic
378.article_body: Transgender activist Shreegauri Sawant said Sushmita Sen was her first choice to play her character in her upcoming biopic 'Taali'. "One should think about how challenging the role will be for a woman with such stature," she said. Shreegauri added that Sushmita has shown courage in taking up the role, which "comes with a lot of taboos".

379.title: 3 people steal food, ₹4,000 from Pune food delivery executive; probe on
379.article_body: Pune Police are looking to catch three persons who allegedly stole food, ₹4,000 cash and valuables from a food delivery executive on Friday night. The victim said that the accused also assaulted him and beat him up with a sharp weapon. Police are collecting the CCTV evidence in the case. A case has also been registered.

380.title: 2 teens who went for picnic drown in check dam in Ranga Reddy
380.article_body: Two teenagers drowned in a check dam in Ranga Reddy's Pedda Amberpet after they went for a picnic with their friends on Sunday. The incident occurred when four members of the group were drowning after they decided to enter the water and some people who were present managed to rescue two of them, according to reports. A case was filed.

381.title: Structural, fire audit ordered in Mumbai's post-mortem centres, mortuaries
381.article_body: Police surgeon Dr Kapil Patil ordered structural, fire and electrical audits of five post-mortem centres in Mumbai. The step was taken after Patil, during his inspection, found that the centres were in bad condition. As per Patil, the waiting room was stuffed with construction material, there was no arrangement for drinking water and lack of forensic experts in the centres.

382.title: Elon Musk reveals how Tesla caught employee who leaked data in 2008
382.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has revealed how the company caught an employee who leaked confidential data and sold it to a news outlet in 2008. "We sent what appeared to be identical emails to all, but each was...coded with either one or two spaces between sentences, forming a binary signature that identified the leaker," explained Musk in a tweet.

383.title: 1 dead, 2 injured after massive blast at Uran power plant in Navi Mumbai
383.article_body: One person was killed and two others were injured in a massive blast that took place in a power generation plant in Uran in Navi Mumbai. Reports said that the boiler pump exploded at the gas turbine power station and triggered a fire. Maharashtra State Power Generation Company has said that the boiler has been shut for a while.

384.title: 2-year-old girl run over by man reversing his car in Delhi's Rohini
384.article_body: A two-year-old girl was killed after a man, who was reversing his car, ran over her in Rohini's Sector-16 in Delhi at around 1:00 pm on Sunday. Police said the child was playing on the road outside her house when she was hit by her neighbour's car. The car's driver has been apprehended and is being questioned.

385.title: Thane woman given abortion pills after wrong sonography report, dies
385.article_body: A 28-year-old pregnant woman died after she was given abortion pills based on a wrong sonography report in Thane's Kalyan. A doctor allegedly issued the report stating that the baby's growth was not proper and hence she was given pills, leading to her death. Meanwhile, police have registered an offence of culpable homicide not amounting to murder against the doctor.

386.title: Power supply to Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant restored after disruption
386.article_body: The external power supply to the Russian-controlled Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant was restored on Sunday, Ukraine's state nuclear company Energoatom said. The plant had lost its last remaining line linking it to the power grid early on Saturday due to shelling. The plant had to switch to backup diesel generators for its own needs, such as cooling the reactor blocks.

387.title: Delhi reports 79 fresh COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
387.article_body: Delhi recorded 79 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.52% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Sunday. No deaths due to the infection were reported in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 385, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi's total case tally reached 20,04,120.

388.title: Stray dog bites former Kerala MLA and 3 others in Palakkad, caught
388.article_body: Former Palakkad MLA KK Divakaran and three other persons, including a child, were bitten by a stray dog in the Noorani Thondikulam area of Kerala on Saturday. As per reports, the dog first bit Divakaran's leg and when he tried to escape, it bit him again on his hands. All four are reportedly undergoing treatment at the district hospital.

389.title: Hyderabad & Mumbai City play out 3-3 draw to kick off ISL campaign
389.article_body: Defending champions Hyderabad FC and Mumbai City FC played out a 3-3 draw at the Shree Shiv Chhatrapati Sports Complex in Pune to kick off their respective 2022-2023 ISL campaigns. Mumbai scored first but Hyderabad levelled the scores with a penalty just before half-time. After Hyderabad took the lead in the second half, Mumbai equalised in the 85th minute.

390.title: India to host UNSC members for key counter-terror meet on Oct 28, 29
390.article_body: India will host diplomats from all the UNSC member states for a key meeting of the Counter-Terrorism Committee (CTC) in Mumbai and New Delhi on October 28-29. "Members of the UN CTC will pay homage to victims of 26/11 terror attacks in Mumbai," India's Permanent Representative to the UN said. India is currently Chair of the Security Council Counter-Terrorism Committee.

391.title: Amul to be merged with 5 other cooperative societies: Amit Shah
391.article_body: Minister of Co-operation Amit Shah said that Amul will be merged with five other cooperative societies to form a multi-state cooperative society (MSCS) and added that the merger process has already commenced. Shah added that the government is giving priority to natural and digital agriculture. The MSCS will certify the product and ensure their export, Amit Shah said.

392.title: Team India players attend Australia-England T20I in Perth, Ashwin shares pic
392.article_body: Team India T20 World Cup squad players, including Ravichandran Ashwin, Harshal Patel, Yuzvendra Chahal and Dinesh Karthik, attended the first Australia-England T20I in Perth on Sunday. Ashwin took to Instagram Stories to share a picture. Notably, Perth is Team India's base for the T20 World Cup 2022. England defeated Australia by 8 runs in the match.

393.title: Super pumped, motivated to end the season: Djokovic on back-to-back titles
393.article_body: When asked if his hunger for titles went up after missing a big phase of the season, Novak Djokovic, who won back-to-back titles in Tel Aviv and Astana, said, "Well, it did." He added, "I couldn't ask for a better restart to the season. More than three months since...Wimbledon final." He further said, "I'm super pumped...motivated to end the season."

394.title: 185 including 19 children killed in Iran protests: Rights group
394.article_body: At least 185 people, including at least 19 children, have been killed in the crackdown on protests across Iran that were sparked by Mahsa Amini's death, Norway-based Iran Human Rights said on Saturday. "The highest...killings occurred in Sistan and Baluchistan province with half the recorded number," the group added. Tehran holds that the protests are a ploy by Iran's enemies.

395.title: When I went into bat, felt that wicket was playing good: Shreyas on his 113*
395.article_body: After his unbeaten 113 runs off 111 balls in India's seven-wicket win against South Africa in second ODI, batter Shreyas Iyer said he felt the wicket was playing good when he came to bat. "The talk between me and Ishan Kishan was to play the ball on merit, build a partnership," he added. Shreyas was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

396.title: Was in God's hands: Sainz on crashing during rain-hit Japanese GP
396.article_body: Ferrari F1's Carlos Sainz said he was "in God's hands" after he crashed his car during the rain-hit Japanese Grand Prix. "When I stopped in the middle of the track and the other cars were coming. I knew they couldn't see me," said Sainz. He added that the "conditions were impossible" and the race should have been a rolling start.

397.title: Chinese ambassador to US thanks Musk for Taiwan proposal
397.article_body: China's ambassador to the US thanked Tesla CEO Elon Musk for his proposal suggesting that Taiwan's dispute with China could be resolved by handing over Beijing some control. The Chinese ambassador took to Twitter to thank Musk for "his idea about establishing a special administrative zone for Taiwan". China has offered Taiwan a system of "one country, two systems".

398.title: Aaron Finch breaks Rohit's world record, takes fewest balls to reach 3,000 T20I runs
398.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has broken the world record for taking the fewest number of balls to reach 3,000 runs in T20I cricket, achieving the feat in the first T20I against England on Sunday. The 35-year-old took 2,078 deliveries to reach the 3,000-run mark. He overtook India captain Rohit Sharma, who had taken 2,149 deliveries to reach the milestone.

399.title: 1 killed, 4 rescued after wall of under-construction mall in Mohali collapses
399.article_body: The wall of an under-construction showroom at Mohali City Centre being built on Mohali Airport road collapsed on Sunday, leading to the death of one labourer. Of the eight labourers who were trapped under the wall's debris, four have been rescued and sent to a hospital, police said. Earthmovers and ambulances have been deployed to rescue remaining labourers.

400.title: Video of crane on track during F1 race goes viral, driver says 'I was 2m away from dying'
400.article_body: A video of a crane on track during Formula One Japanese Grand Prix has gone viral. Scuderia AlphaTauri driver Pierre Gasly was heard telling his team, "Why is...tractor on track? It's unacceptable." He later said in an interview, "I was two metres away from dying." Notably, Jules Bianchi died during Japanese Grand Prix 2014 after colliding with recovery vehicle.
